trans-unit.target: TEXT_FESANX001_05015_SEQ_00<tab>The wandering minstrel seeks an adventurer both willing and able to help put the finishing touches to this year's Rising celebrations. ※This quest is available for a limited time only.

TEXT_FESANX001_05015_SEQ_01<tab>A lady by the name of Ayoyo has already recruited the wandering minstrel to her cause─that being the planning and execution of the grand finale of the Rising fireworks display. He recruits you in turn, the task apparently calling for the assistance of a seasoned adventurer. He begs that you meet with him and Ayoyo by the base of the Coral Tower in Limsa Lominsa's upper decks to learn more.
※Please note that you will be unable to complete this quest after the seasonal event has ended. For details, please check the Lodestone.

TEXT_FESANX001_05015_SEQ_02<tab>You speak with Ayoyo and offer to lend her your strength in producing a firework display that will long remain in Lominsan memory. The minstrel proposes that you begin by interviewing those who have gathered in the city to learn their inner thoughts.
TEXT_FESANX001_05015_SEQ_03<tab>You meet with Ayoyo by the entrance to Hawker's Alley, and split up to begin your polite interrogation of the populace.

TEXT_FESANX001_05015_SEQ_04<tab>You speak with a sample of the people assembled in and around Hawker's Alley, and gain insight into their thoughts and feelings come Rising season. You head for the ferry docks to wait for Ayoyo to complete her own research.

TEXT_FESANX001_05015_SEQ_05<tab>Ayoyo finds you by the ferry docks and you compare notes. Having come to some conclusion regarding the ideal nature of the crowning display of this year's festivities, she departs for the Aftcastle to inform the wandering minstrel. She bids you meet her there.

TEXT_FESANX001_05015_SEQ_06<tab>You and Ayoyo rendezvous with the wandering minstrel and inform him of your plans. However, there are many and more hurdles that must be cleared before said plans can be put into effect. Ayoyo asks for your continued assistance in seeing her vision realized.
TEXT_FESANX001_05015_TODO_00<tab>Speak with Ayoyo.
TEXT_FESANX001_05015_TODO_01<tab>Speak with Ayoyo in the aetheryte plaza.
TEXT_FESANX001_05015_TODO_02<tab>Gather information in Hawker's Alley.
TEXT_FESANX001_05015_TODO_03<tab>Rendezvous with Ayoyo at the ferry docks.
TEXT_FESANX001_05015_TODO_04<tab>Speak with the wandering minstrel at the Aftcastle.

TEXT_FESANX001_05015_WANDERINGMINSTREL_000_001<tab>Of all the coincidences! You will hardly believe it, but I was just this very moment reminiscing of the time you lent me your strength a twelvemonth past.

TEXT_FESANX001_05015_WANDERINGMINSTREL_000_002<tab>You see, I again find myself in pressing need of an adventurer's aid, just as I did last Rising. “Oh, if only <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var> were here,” I thought to myself...and here you are! Well, then, what do you say? Shall we clasp arms once more?

TEXT_FESANX001_05015_WANDERINGMINSTREL_000_003<tab>Greetings, friend. By your dauntless bearing, I assume you are an adventurer─and come at precisely the moment I find myself in need of an adventurer's aid. Might I beg yours?

TEXT_FESANX001_05015_WANDERINGMINSTREL_000_004<tab>My thanks. The matter is this: I have been approached by a lady named Ayoyo who wishes to imprint her own inimitable mark upon the skies above Limsa Lominsa─I speak, of course, of the fireworks that illumine these Rising nights. Learning of my contribution to previous years' festivities, she has enlisted me to her cause.

TEXT_FESANX001_05015_WANDERINGMINSTREL_000_005<tab>We already have the ear of the organizing committee. However, Lady Ayoyo has expressed a strong desire to consult with a storied adventurer before finalizing her proposal.
TEXT_FESANX001_05015_WANDERINGMINSTREL_000_006<tab>Come to the Yellowjackets' guardhouse at the base of the Coral Tower and I will introduce you.
TEXT_FESANX001_05015_WANDERINGMINSTREL_000_010<tab>Lady Ayoyo. One storied adventurer, as promised.
TEXT_FESANX001_05015_AYOYO_000_011<tab>Blessin's o' the Twelve upon ye. Name's Ayoyo, cannoneer first class with the Yellowjackets. 'S an 'onor to 'ave ye on board!

TEXT_FESANX001_05015_WANDERINGMINSTREL_000_012<tab>Did I mention that it is the Yellowjackets who are in charge of this year's festivities? Not only in decorating of these fair Lominsan streets, but in designing and constructing the fireworks that brighten the skies above them.

TEXT_FESANX001_05015_WANDERINGMINSTREL_000_013<tab>Lady Ayoyo here is quite the savant in all matters incendiary and explosive, and so it has fallen to her to formulate a plan for the display's crowning glory.

TEXT_FESANX001_05015_AYOYO_000_014<tab>Me an' the other lads an' lassies of the cannoneers whipped up a load o' luvverly little drakes, snakes, and devils fer the Moonfire Faire, but more o' the same ain't goin' to cut it fer the Risin'.
TEXT_FESANX001_05015_AYOYO_000_016<tab>'Cause it's all about rememberin' those we lost in the Calamity, ain't it? Them an' theirs deserve somethin' a mite specialer than a bunch of old bangers.

TEXT_FESANX001_05015_WANDERINGMINSTREL_000_017<tab>An admirable sentiment, I'm sure. It would not do for our ode to such poignant memories to be aught less than memorable. Let us make this year's Rising one that the citizens of this fair realm will not soon forget.

TEXT_FESANX001_05015_AYOYO_000_018<tab>Took the words right out o' me mouth, dearie. Thing is, 'avin' 'ardly set foot out of Limsa in all me days, I don't reckon I'm best placed to know what's goin' through the minds o' the “citizens o' this fair realm”...
TEXT_FESANX001_05015_WANDERINGMINSTREL_000_019<tab>And so you would pick an adventurer's brains. One who has journeyed far and wide across this land we love, and knows it and its people intimately.

TEXT_FESANX001_05015_WANDERINGMINSTREL_000_020<tab>Yet before we call upon your particular wisdom, mayhap it would behoove us to seek out a wider range of opinions. Many and more look to the skies come Rising night, and the thoughts that run through their minds are no doubt as diverse. Let us learn them.
TEXT_FESANX001_05015_AYOYO_000_021<tab>Sounds like a plan! Mind if I join ye, dearie? Could do with learnin' some o' these thoughts meself.

TEXT_FESANX001_05015_AYOYO_000_022<tab>Right, then! Where's best to start askin' around? Some place a lot of outsiders gather, I reckon... 'Ow about we meet in the aetheryte plaza, down in the lower decks?
TEXT_FESANX001_05015_WANDERINGMINSTREL_000_023<tab>While you two are so engaged, allow me to continue our discussions with the organizing committee. I shall await you by the Aftcastle.

TEXT_FESANX001_05015_WANDERINGMINSTREL_000_024<tab>Much and more are the preparations required for a firework display on such a grand scale, and every detail must be approved by the organizing committee. But let that be my concern─your primary objective must be the conception of the display itself.
TEXT_FESANX001_05015_MOB05015_000_025<tab>Can you see them too, my love...?
TEXT_FESANX001_05015_SWOZBLAET_000_026<tab>The market is always bustling around the Rising season. Reminds me of the time the Grand Companies were restored.

TEXT_FESANX001_05015_MOB205015_000_027<tab>The streets're full o' life, the sky's full o' fire, and the westerly wind's fillin' our seafarer's sails as it does our 'earts. Ahhh, I couldn't've picked a better time to come home.
TEXT_FESANX001_05015_SDHODJBI_000_028<tab>Ah, balls. Should have written down what Baderon wanted...
TEXT_FESANX001_05015_AYOYO_000_030<tab>Ye see them lights down 'Awker's alley, dearie? Decorations fer the festival, they are.
TEXT_FESANX001_05015_AYOYO_000_031<tab>Every year, when the streets are all decked out fer the Risin', me 'eart fills with...well, all kinds o' feelin's. Sorrow, pride. Regret...

TEXT_FESANX001_05015_AYOYO_000_032<tab>But enough about me! We came 'ere to find out 'ow the other folks feel about it. Let's split up, head down the alley, and ask a few likely-lookin' customers each.
TEXT_FESANX001_05015_AYOYO_000_033<tab>We're on a schedule 'ere, so don't go askin' every single soul ye see. Four or five should do ye. I'll meet ye down by the ferry docks when ye're done!
TEXT_FESANX001_05015_AYOYO_000_034<tab>Sorry to bother ye, dearie, but if I could be so bold...would ye mind tellin' me what the Risin' means to ye?
TEXT_FESANX001_05015_MOB05015_000_040<tab>Can you see them too, my love? ...Hm?

TEXT_FESANX001_05015_MOB05015_000_041<tab>...You're involved with the fireworks, and want to know what I think of them? Well, just now I was wondering if they can be seen from far out in the offing. Do you know?
TEXT_FESANX001_05015_MOB05015_000_042<tab>...I see. The reason I ask is that my husband is out there now. He meant to be back by Rising night, but it seems the tide didn't turn in his favor.

TEXT_FESANX001_05015_MOB05015_000_043<tab>He was so looking forward to the fireworks. I do hope that he can see them from where he is─that we can share them together, no matter how far apart we might be.

TEXT_FESANX001_05015_MOB05015_000_044<tab>That is my only request to you: that you make the finale as bright and boisterous as you can, that all those who cannot be together this Rising might still share in its message.

TEXT_FESANX001_05015_MOB05015_000_045<tab>There are many like me who cannot be with their loved ones this Rising─whether by chance, or by tragedy. It is the fireworks that bring them together─so the louder and brighter they are, the better.

TEXT_FESANX001_05015_SWOZBLAET_000_050<tab>Welcome, welcome! What may I interest you in this fine <var 08 E3E90C0D ((<var 08 E3E90C05 ((evening)) ((morning)) /var>)) ((<var 08 E3E90C12 ((day)) ((evening)) /var>)) /var>?

TEXT_FESANX001_05015_SWOZBLAET_000_051<tab>...Ah, information, is it? Well, if you really must know, the whizzing and banging that fills the air this season always takes me back to the time just before the Calamity struck.

TEXT_FESANX001_05015_SWOZBLAET_000_052<tab>A great festival was held to celebrate the reformation of the Grand Companies. People in the streets were hooting, and hollering, and setting off firespouts, and all the ships in the bay, now bedecked in Maelstrom colors, let loose their cannons.

TEXT_FESANX001_05015_SWOZBLAET_000_053<tab>It seems so foolish now, knowing what was soon to befall us. But all that noise served a purpose nonetheless─drowning out the fear that ever whispered in our ears.

TEXT_FESANX001_05015_SWOZBLAET_000_054<tab>It is my firm belief that the Rising fireworks serve the same purpose even now─they present a vision of loveliness, of togetherness, that we might forget our fears and be given hope for a brighter future.

TEXT_FESANX001_05015_SWOZBLAET_000_055<tab><var 1A 02 /var>Aesthetics<var 1A 01 /var>, my dear <var 08 E905 ((girl)) ((boy)) /var>. That's what we need. A dash of true beauty to drive the shadows from our hearts and give us hope for the future.

TEXT_FESANX001_05015_MOB205015_000_060<tab>The streets are full o' life, the sky's full o' fire, and the westerly wind's fillin' our seafarer's sails as it does our 'earts. Ahhh, I couldn't've picked a better time to come home. You a sailor too, are you?
TEXT_FESANX001_05015_MOB205015_000_061<tab>...Helpin' with the fireworks, ye say? Good on ye, <var 08 E905 ((lass)) ((lad)) /var>. Aye, I've a few memories o' back then, if you've an ear to 'ear 'em.

TEXT_FESANX001_05015_MOB205015_000_062<tab>I'm a merchant seaman, ye see, always sailin' hither an' thither across the waves. Was just back from a trip to Radz<var 1F /var>at<var 1F /var>Han when the Calamity struck.
TEXT_FESANX001_05015_MOB205015_000_063<tab>Everyone was lookin' up to the sky, and that loathsome lantern that 'ung low in it.
TEXT_FESANX001_05015_MOB205015_000_064<tab>Like most folk, I don't remember much o' what 'appened in the days before or after it fell, but I'll never forget those faces.

TEXT_FESANX001_05015_MOB205015_000_065<tab>And that's what I love so much about the fireworks. Ye see the same faces lookin' up, but this time with a smile─reminds ye not only o' the bad times, but 'ow we got over 'em.

TEXT_FESANX001_05015_MOB205015_000_066<tab>'Course, 'alf the folk who were watchin' Dalamud back then ain't with us no more. But they'll be watching the fireworks too, an' I reckon they'll bring the same smile to their faces as they do ours.
TEXT_FESANX001_05015_SDHODJBI_000_070<tab>Alright there. Anything I can do for you?

TEXT_FESANX001_05015_SDHODJBI_000_071<tab>...You're asking for people's thoughts on the Rising fireworks? Heh! Would've thought a great hero like you would have better things to do with your time...but I suppose that's what <var 1A 02 /var>makes<var 1A 01 /var> you a hero, eh? Helping people out whichever way you can.
TEXT_FESANX001_05015_SDHODJBI_000_072<tab>...You're asking for people's thoughts on the Rising fireworks? Heh! You adventurers don't half pick up some odd jobs.
TEXT_FESANX001_05015_SDHODJBI_000_073<tab>Well...I'm like most people, I suppose. I think of those I lost.
TEXT_FESANX001_05015_SDHODJBI_000_074<tab>My parents, most of all. I wonder if they're watching, too.
TEXT_FESANX001_05015_SDHODJBI_000_075<tab>Swum up from the bottom of the aetherial sea to see what all the crashing and banging's about.
TEXT_FESANX001_05015_SDHODJBI_000_076<tab>It's complicated, I suppose. I feel sad they're gone, but happy I'm not─and grateful to Baderon saving me and so many others.

TEXT_FESANX001_05015_SDHODJBI_000_077<tab>If they <var 1A 02 /var>are<var 1A 01 /var> watching, I hope they can see me, too. See that I'm doing alright for myself, that they might sleep soundly for another twelvemonth.

TEXT_FESANX001_05015_SDHODJBI_000_078<tab>I didn't learn this till long after he'd taken me in, but after the Calamity, Baderon banded together some old allies from his mercenary days and a few willing adventurers. They'd go round seeking out people like me who'd lost everything and try and put them back on their feet.
TEXT_FESANX001_05015_SDHODJBI_000_079<tab>I just made his job easier, drinking myself stupid and puking my guts out in his gutter. Maybe I should get him a little something by way of thanks...
TEXT_FESANX001_05015_AYOYO_000_080<tab>Sorry to keep ye waitin', dearie. So, what did ye find out?
TEXT_FESANX001_05015_AYOYO_000_081<tab>Hmmm... Same 'ere. Was 'alf expectin' 'em to just like lookin' at the pretty lights, but it seems the feelin' runs a lot deeper than that.
TEXT_FESANX001_05015_AYOYO_000_082<tab>The memories o' the Calamity still sit 'eavy on their 'earts, but the Risin' fireworks go some way to liftin' that weight.
TEXT_FESANX001_05015_AYOYO_000_083<tab>So, any ideas fer the grand display? What kind o' thing d'ye reckon'd 'elp lift those spirits the most?
TEXT_FESANX001_05015_Q50_000_001<tab>What will you say?
TEXT_FESANX001_05015_A50_000_002<tab>Something grand and flashy.
TEXT_FESANX001_05015_A50_000_003<tab>Something that reminds people of the past.
TEXT_FESANX001_05015_A50_000_004<tab>Something that gives people hope for the future.

TEXT_FESANX001_05015_AYOYO_000_084<tab>That'd do the job, alright! Ain't a Lominsan among us who ain't got a drop of pirate blood in her veins! Lightin' up the skies with buccaneerin' abandon would be just the way to put our own stamp on this year's festival!

TEXT_FESANX001_05015_AYOYO_000_085<tab>Aye, ye might be right there. It's the same with folk as it is with ships─ye need to know where ye've come from to know where ye're goin'. A reminder of times past might be just the ticket.
TEXT_FESANX001_05015_AYOYO_000_086<tab>Hope fer the future, eh? That ain't a bad idea. Remindin' folk that however dark the night, dawn is just around the corner.
TEXT_FESANX001_05015_AYOYO_000_087<tab>The Risin' ain't just about mournin' those we lost, after all. It's about rememberin' the struggles of those who survived, to steer us to a brighter future.
TEXT_FESANX001_05015_AYOYO_000_088<tab>Aye, that's it... That's what Limsa needs this Risin'...
TEXT_FESANX001_05015_AYOYO_000_089<tab>Ships. Cannons. A departure salute. Not just fer the fallen, but fer those settin' sail fer unknown shores. A vision o' the past, and o' the future...
TEXT_FESANX001_05015_AYOYO_000_090<tab>An 'ole bleedin' armada filling Galadion Bay, lightin' up the very 'eavens! Who wouldn't want to watch that?
TEXT_FESANX001_05015_AYOYO_000_091<tab>That's settled, then! Ah, the minstrel's goin' to love it! 'E said 'e'd be up by the Aftcastle, right? I'll see ye there!
TEXT_FESANX001_05015_AYOYO_000_092<tab>Let's see, now... Fifteen 'undred weight of firesand, at five 'undred yalms from shore... Reckon we're goin' to need more ships.
TEXT_FESANX001_05015_WANDERINGMINSTREL_000_100<tab>Our intrepid adventurer returns─and positively bursting with inspiration, I take it?

TEXT_FESANX001_05015_WANDERINGMINSTREL_000_101<tab>...I see. A traditional seafaring salute, not only to the memories of the fallen, but to the future fortune of those who follow in their wake. A most fitting proposal, I'm sure.
TEXT_FESANX001_05015_AYOYO_000_102<tab>Thanks, the both o' ye...but our work ain't done yet. There's a lot needs sortin' out before we can put this idea into action. So much to do, so little time!
TEXT_FESANX001_05015_AYOYO_000_103<tab>If ye wouldn't mind 'elpin' us a little longer, dearie, I'd be forever in yer debt. Let me know when ye've got yer loins good and girded!
